citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

descript.abstract: Contains physical information on commercial facilities at the principal U.S. Coastal, Great Lakes and Inland Ports. The data consists of listings of port area's waterfront facilities, including information on berthing, cranes, transit sheds, grain elevators, marine repair plants, fleeting areas, and docking and storage facilities. Collection of data is performed on a rotational basis to ensure on-site accuracy at each facility.
descript.purpose: The Navigation Data Center had several objectives in developing the U.S. Waterway Data. These objectives support the concept of a National Spatial Data Provide public access to national waterway data. Foster interagency and intra-agency cooperation through data sharing. Provide a mechanism to integrate waterway data (U.S. Army Corps of Engineers Port/Facility and U.S. Coast Guard Accident Data, for example) Provide a basis for intermodal analysis. Assist standardization of waterway entity definitions (Ports/Facilities, Locks, etc.). Provide public access to the National Waterway Network, which can be used as a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data (waterway and modal network/facility databases, for example). Provide reliable data to support future waterway and intermodal applications.

citeinfo.origin: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)
citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013

pubinfo.publish: Research and Innovative Technology Administration's Bureau of Transportation Statistics (RITA/BTS)

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy is tested by manual comparison of the source with hard copy printouts and/or symbolized display of digital line graphs on an interactive computer graphic system; selected attributes that cannot be visually verified on plots or on screen, are interactively queried and verified on screen.

dataqual.logic: RITA/BTS quality checks were to cross reference the place dataset with the state dataset, to determine that the spatial data and attribute data were accurate

horizpa.horizpar: The accuracy of each point element is correlated to the data source used to derive that element. For example, links and nodes derived from 1:100,000 scale Digital Line Graphs are more accurate than links and nodes derived from 1:500,000 scale NOAA Navigational Charts. Elements with an "M" in the source field (indicating an unknown or missing source) are the least accurate.

citeinfo.origin: Vanderbilt Engineering Center for Transportation Operations and Research Vanderbilt University
citeinfo.title: USACE Port Database

procstep.procdesc: Extraction of the USACE identified port nodes from the National Waterway Network file.

enttyp.enttypd: A description of the physical and Intermodal (infrastructure) characteristics of the: coastal, Great Lakes, and inland ports of the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Alphanumeric unique identifier for a facility
Textual description of the location of the facility
Facility type i.e. ('Dock', 'Fleeting Area', 'Lock and/or Dam', 'Milepoint', etc.)
City or town where facility is located
Name of waterway where facility is located
Port in which the wharf is located
Waterway mile of wharf location above or below a datum point
Current operators of the facility with phone and fax numbers
Current owner or owner/operators of the facility with phone and fax numbers
Waterborne Commerce Statistics Center's three digit dock code
List of commodities handled at the facility at the two digit Lock Performance Monitoring System level
Description of equipment available at the facility
Remarks, including description of wharf - related storage facilities and their operators
Largest single berthing space in feet
The 2-character FIPS code of the State or State equivalent

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 3-character FIPS code of the County or County equivalent

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: Bank of river for wharf location (Left or Right)
Waterborne Commerce Statistics Center's five digit location code
Purpose for which wharf is used, including commodities handled and/or services performed

digtinfo.filedec: No compression applied. However, if using digital transfer online option, note access instructions.

stdorder.ordering: Call (202-366-DATA), or E-mail (answers@bts.gov) RITA/BTS to request the National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2013 DVD. The NTAD DVD can be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov. Individual datasets from the NTAD can also be downloaded from the Office of Geospatial Information Systems website at http://www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services/
